com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen

Enum DigitalPenManager.Area

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<DigitalPenManager.Area>
      • com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager.Area
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DigitalPenManager.Area>
    Enclosing class:
    DigitalPenManager

    public static enum DigitalPenManager.Area
extends java.lang.Enum<DigitalPenManager.Area>
    Describes areas around the device. Note that ALL refers to area not otherwise registered, so for example if ON_SCREEN is registered, it will "punch through" ALL and the on-screen listener will be called instead of the all listener for points on-screen.
    See Also:
    DigitalPenManager.registerSideChannelEventListener(com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager.Area, com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager.OnSideChannelDataListener), DigitalPenManager.unregisterSideChannelEventListener(com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager.Area)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ALL
      Refers to all areas not otherwise currently registered
      OFF_SCREEN
      Refers to the off-screen area to the side of the device
      OFF_SCREEN_BACKGROUND
      Like OFF_SCREEN, refers to the off-screen area to the side of the device.
      ON_SCREEN
      Refers to the device's screen

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • OFF_SCREEN

        public static final DigitalPenManager.Area OFF_SCREEN
        Refers to the off-screen area to the side of the device

      • ON_SCREEN

        public static final DigitalPenManager.Area ON_SCREEN
        Refers to the device's screen

      • ALL

        public static final DigitalPenManager.Area ALL
        Refers to all areas not otherwise currently registered

      • OFF_SCREEN_BACKGROUND

        public static final DigitalPenManager.Area OFF_SCREEN_BACKGROUND
        Like OFF_SCREEN, refers to the off-screen area to the side of the device. However, this area's listener will continue to be called once this application is in the background.

        If another application also tries to use the DigitalPenManager while this application is in background, this application's listener will be canceled.

        See Also:
        DigitalPenManager.setBackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener(BackgroundSideChannelCanceledListener)
